---
title: "Auto-Generated Diagrams"
description: "See your Terraform as diagrams automatically"
---

# Auto-Generated Diagrams

Visualize your infrastructure from Terraform without manual drawing.

## How It Works
- Kyrna parses your Terraform (AWS + DigitalOcean) and builds a resource graph.
- Groups by VPC/VNet, subnets, security groups, load balancers, services, data stores.
- Renders automatically when you generate or import infrastructure.

## What You Get
- **Network view:** VPC/VNet, subnets, gateways, load balancers, routes.
- **Service view:** EC2/ECS/EKS, Lambda, RDS, S3; DO droplets, DOKS, DBs, Spaces.
- **Relations:** Security groups/firewalls, target groups, DNS, dependencies.
- **Cost & status badges:** Optional overlay for estimated cost and basic health.

## Usage
1. Generate or import Terraform in Kyrna.
2. Open the **Diagrams** tab to view the auto-rendered architecture.
3. Hover nodes for details; click to jump to the Terraform snippet.

## Current Status
- Providers: AWS, DigitalOcean
- Updates on each regenerate/import
- Export: PNG/SVG
- Coming soon: share links & version diffs
